Field Detail

save_top_digest

public boolean save_top_digest
this is the same check as "save_digest" but only performed at top level, ie; at the beginning and end of move generation. This is cheap - but should catch errors in games that were thought to be debugged.

current_depth

public int current_depth
the current search depth

save_digest

public boolean save_digest

finished

public boolean finished

search_clock

public int search_clock
this counter is incremented each time a move is selected as the next move at a deeper search level. It's copied to move.search_clock just before, so move.search_clock represents the time when this move became "current" for and search continues on from there.

it's a useful debugging technique to stop when a suspicious move (for example, the bad move that was eventually chosen) becomes "current".

Because conditional breakpoints can be quite slow, the variable stop_at_eval_clock is available. When the clock reaches the specified value, Search_Break is called where you can put an unconditional breakpoint.

stop_at_search_clock

public int stop_at_search_clock
call Search_Break when search_clock reaches the specified value.

eval_clock

public int eval_clock
this variable is incremented just before each move is statically evaluated. Breakpoints etc can be set based on this value.

stop_at_eval_clock

public int stop_at_eval_clock
if not -1, call Search_Break when eval_clock reaches this value.

max_depth

public int max_depth
In alpha-beta searches, the max search depth in the current search. In progressive searches, this may be less than final_depth. This value is passed as the second argument to RobotProtocol.Depth_Limit(int, int) which mediates setting the depth limit of alpha-beta searches. In UCT searches, max_depth is copied from final_depth.

final_depth

public int final_depth
In progressive alpha-beta searches, the absolute depth limit for this or any other search. In UCT searches, the level at which random playouts terminate, even if no end of game is reached.

check_duplicate_digests

public boolean check_duplicate_digests
it's not strictly an error, but all the moves suggested by List_Of_Legal_Moves should be different. If you turn this on, digests of all the moves are compared, and duplicates cause an error. This is a handy way of detecting move lists that could be improved. In some games, it may be impractically difficult to remove all duplicates, and certainly this test ought to be turned off once development is complete.

allDigests

public IntObjHashtable<commonMove> allDigests
digests of all the moves evaluated. Used if check_duplicate_digests is in effect.

verbose

public int verbose
the controls verbosity of messages about the progress of the search.
  • 0 no messages
  • 1 describe new principle variations and parameters for new progressive searches
  • 2 describe all top level variations.

    getCurrentVariation

    public abstract commonMove getCurrentVariation()
    this is used to save the current variation leading to positions of interest found by the robots. The known users of this interface are Gyges and Universe.

    Returns:
    a linked list of commonMove linked through the "next" element.

    getCurrent2PVariation

    public abstract commonMove getCurrent2PVariation()
    this is used to save the current variation leading to positions of interest found by the robots. This version inserts a "done" each time the player changes.

    Returns:
    a linked list of commonMove linked through the "next" element.
